recentPerformance.last3Games: JT Toppin coming off 31 pts/14 reb game
recentPerformance.cushion: Line moved only 3 points with Ivisic out (should've moved 5-6)

keyFactors.title: Tomislav Ivisic OUT (Significant Injury)
keyFactors.description: Illinois's 7-foot starting center (13 PPG) sidelined. Massive interior presence lost.

keyFactors.title: JT Toppin Advantage
keyFactors.description: Texas Tech's best big man coming off dominant 31 pts/14 reb game. Expected to dominate without Ivisic.

keyFactors.title: Line Underreaction
keyFactors.description: Line moved only 3 points with Ivisic out when 5-6 point move was appropriate. Market underreacted to injury impact.

keyFactors.title: Projected Margin
keyFactors.description: Models showed Illinois win by only 1-2 points, making +3.5 valuable.

riskFactors: Illinois depth could compensate for Ivisic's absence
Texas Tech 3PT shooting could go cold on road

playerStats.stojakovic: 23 pts off bench for Illinois (first full game back from knee)
playerStats.zvonimir: 11 pts, 7 reb (Tomislav's twin brother stepped up)

quarterBreakdown.description: Texas Tech started 7-0, then Illinois responded with 11-0 run. Competitive start.
Illinois 45, Texas Tech 32 (13-point deficit). Free throw disparity already emerging.
Texas Tech shot 11-12 to start half, took 56-55 lead. Illinois responded with 8-0 run to 72-65 lead in final 5 minutes. Tech cut to 76-73 with 50 seconds left but couldn't complete comeback.

gameResults.whenMissed: Final: Illinois 81, Texas Tech 77 (4-point margin, needed 3 or less to cover +3.5)
gameResults.gamePace: Both teams had 13 turnovers, but Illinois scored 29 points off turnovers vs Tech's 16 (13-point gap).

criticalStats.freeThrows: Illinois 16-23, Texas Tech 3-4 (13-point FT advantage in 4-point game)
criticalStats.turnovers: Both 13, but Illinois scored 29 pts off TOs vs Tech's 16 (13-point conversion gap)

whatWentWrong.title: Free Throw Massacre (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentWrong.description: Illinois shot 16-23 FT, Texas Tech shot 3-4 FT. 13-point disparity in made free throws decided 4-point game. Texas Tech coach: 'They were more physical than we were at getting to the basket and getting fouls.'

whatWentWrong.title: Illinois Depth Without Ivisic
whatWentWrong.description: Andrej Stojakovic (23 pts off bench, first full game back from knee), twin brother Zvonimir Ivisic (11 pts, 7 reb), Kylan Boswell (22 pts) all stepped up. Depth covered injury.

whatWentWrong.title: Turnover Conversion Gap
whatWentWrong.description: Both had 13 turnovers, but Illinois scored 29 points off turnovers vs Texas Tech's 16. 13-point gap in conversion was decisive.

whatWentWrong.title: First Half Deficit Too Large
whatWentWrong.description: Down 13 at halftime (45-32), Tech expended enormous energy to come back and briefly take lead, but couldn't sustain effort.

whatWentWrong.title: Texas Tech 3PT Struggles
whatWentWrong.description: 6-22 from three (27.3%), especially 4-12 in first half when they fell behind. Christian Anderson went 0-6 from three.

statisticalContext.vsProjection: Lost by 4 on +3.5 spread (0.5 points off)
statisticalContext.toppinDelivered: 35 pts, 11 reb on 17-25 shooting as predicted
statisticalContext.illinoisBreakthrough: First ranked non-conference home win under Brad Underwood (hired 2017)
statisticalContext.historicalContext: The 'Illinois home curse' narrative was from PREVIOUS season (2024-25), not current year—misleading framing

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Partially. JT Toppin delivered exactly as predicted (35 pts, 11 reb). But 13-point free throw advantage and 13-point turnover conversion gap were not foreseeable. Missed by half a point (0.5) in what could've been a push or cover.

closingLineValue.verdict: Neutral CLV. Line held steady around +3.5 throughout.

keyTakeaways: Free throw differential is often decisive: 13-point FT advantage neutralized strong performance from Toppin
Depth matters when stars miss: Illinois's bench (Stojakovic 23 pts) and twin center (Zvonimir) covered Ivisic's absence
Verify historical context carefully: 'Home curse' narrative was from previous season, not current year—misleading framing
Turnover quality matters more than quantity: Both had 13 turnovers, but Illinois scored 13 more points off them
Close-but-no-cigar losses sting most: Losing by 4 on +3.5 spread (half-point) after coming back from 13 down
Toppin delivered as predicted but team couldn't overcome free throw/hustle gaps
verdict: Analysis was partially sound (Toppin delivered, Ivisic absence mattered) but missed free throw/depth factors. Grade: C+
